title: China’s New Boss in Hong Kong
sub_head: John Lee becomes Xi Jinping’s enforcer with 99% of the vote.
body:
One measure of authoritarian “democracy” is when the winner takes nearly all of the vote. That’s the tale of John Lee’s victory this weekend as Hong Kong’s new chief executive.
Mr. Lee “was eventually elected with 99 per cent of the votes,” declared China’s Hong Kong and Macau Affairs Officein a statement after the election. “This shows completely that Hong Kong highly recognises him.”
